intro: Isoloba lusitanica, commonly known as the Lusitanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Isoloba lusitanica is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
